documentType: grand jury subpoena with attached financial record
summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued to Larry Visoski, commanding him to testify and produce records related to Jeffrey Epstein, his aircraft, and his own employment. It includes a W-2 tax form for the year 2005, indicating Visoski was an employee of a company related to Epstein. The document is part of the 2006 federal investigation into Epstein.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Individual commanded to appear before a grand jury and produce records related to Jeffrey Epstein, aircraft, and his own employment. His 2005 W-2 form is attached.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure of the grand jury investigation. The subpoena seeks all records related to him, his aircraft, and methods to contact him.

connections.description: Visoski's 2005 W-2 form is attached to the subpoena, and the subpoena seeks his employment records, indicating a financial/employment relationship with Epstein or an Epstein-related entity.

events.title: Grand Jury Testimony of Larry Visoski
events.description: Larry Visoski is commanded to appear and testify before the Grand Jury at the U.S. District Courthouse in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: A grand jury subpoena is issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida to Larry Visoski.

locations: United States District Courthouse, 701 Clematis Street, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401
keyFacts: Larry Visoski was subpoenaed to testify before a federal grand jury on December 1, 2006, as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The subpoena demanded all records related to Jeffrey Epstein, the Gulfstream N909JE, the Boeing N908JF, and Visoski's own employment.
A 2005 W-2 tax form for Larry Visoski is attached to the subpoena, providing concrete evidence of his employment and financial earnings for that year.
The document shows the investigation sought detailed contact information for Jeffrey Epstein from 2004 onward, including phone numbers and email addresses.
The subpoena is marked as subject to a protective order, indicating the sensitive nature of the grand jury proceedings.
